intro: Microdesmis camerunensis, commonly known as the Cameroon microdesmis, is a flowering plant native to Central Africa. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its small, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of yellow and orange. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in tropical rainforests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and less-studied species.
